metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5554 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 6u121, 7u111, 8u102; and JavaSE Embedded 8u101 allows remote attackers to affect integrity via vectorsrelated to JMX.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-source - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-6-demo - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-6-jre - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-6-source - 6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b40-1.13.12-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
